Class Utils

java.lang.Object
heparansulfate.Utils
public class Utils extends Object
General utility methods, primarily handling I/O operations and basic statistics, used across several classes in the package.

  • Method Details

    • getRandIndexInF

      public static int getRandIndexInF(double[] F, Random rand)
      Performs a random selection of an index based on cumulative probabilities.
      Parameters:
      F - Array of cumulative probabilities.
      rand - Random number generator.
      Returns:
      A random index i such that the selection is based on the interval probabilities defined by F.

    • getMin

      public static double getMin(double[] x)
      Finds the minimum value in an array.
      Parameters:
      x - Array of double values.
      Returns:
      The minimum value in x.

    • getMax

      public static double getMax(double[] x)
      Finds the maximum value in an array.
      Parameters:
      x - Array of double values.
      Returns:
      The maximum value in x.

    • getAverage

      public static double getAverage(double[] x)
      Calculates the arithmetic average of an array.
      Parameters:
      x - Array of double values.
      Returns:
      The average of the values in x.

    • getSD

      public static double getSD(double[] x)
      Calculates the sample standard deviation of an array.
      Parameters:
      x - Array of double values.
      Returns:
      The standard deviation of the values in x.

    • loadFileNoheader

      public static List<String> loadFileNoheader(String file)
      Loads a tab-delimited ASCII file into a list of strings, skipping the header.
      Parameters:
      file - Path to the tab-delimited ASCII file.
      Returns:
      A List of strings, where each element represents a line from the file.

    • saveFile

      public static void saveFile(List<String> v, String file)
      Saves each element of a list into a line of an ASCII file.
      Parameters:
      v - List containing the lines to be saved.
      file - Path to the output file.
